channel.title: Custom Server Status
channel.description:
I'm still making my website, but I don't know what to do to make a custom server status. I want it to check if the ips and ports below are available:
76.105.48.63:6900 76.105.48.63:6121 76.105.48.63:5121
der.

item.title: Custom Server Status
item.dc:creator: @nator123123 nator123123
item.description:
@nator123123 wrote:

Oopsies, that post ip was wrong, I was on another network because my internetz was slow on there.

EDIT: Does anyone know a page or program that lets me save a php page as a php file with the true contents?
I find this probably rare.

EDIT2: ORRRRR,
if anyone knows ragnarok here, give me a working ragnarok server status script.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @nator123123 nator123123
item.description:
@nator123123 wrote:

I already tried that, but I wanted to try to see if it worked with quotes.

Nidz moar help.

Read full topic

item.title: Custom Server Status
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Don’t put the ports in quotes, that might do it.

edit:

from my page:

      $fp = fsockopen($ip, $port, $errno, $errstr, 4);
      if (!$fp) {
          echo "The server " . $name . " is offline, it must be online before you can register it here.";
          return;
      }
      fclose($fp);

Read full topic

item.title: Custom Server Status
item.dc:creator: @nator123123 nator123123
item.description:
@nator123123 wrote:

It works if I use the regular port (80), but now when I use my server ports.
Do any of you know why?

here’s the script:

				<?php
					$status1 = fsockopen("76.105.48.63", "5121");
					$status2 = fsockopen("76.105.48.63", "6121");
					$status3 = fsockopen("76.105.48.63", "6900");
					
					if($status1){
						echo("<tr><td><font style=color:white;font-size:9pt>Map Server<td>: </font></td></td><td><font style=color:green;font-size:9pt>Online</font></td></tr>");
					}
					else
					{
						echo("<tr><td><font style=color:white;font-size:9pt>Map Server<td>: </font></td></td><td><font style=color:red;font-size:9pt>Offline</font></td></tr>");					
					}

					if($status2){
						echo("<tr><td><font style=color:white;font-size:9pt>Character Server<td>: </font></td></td><td><font style=color:red;font-size:9pt>Offline</font></td></tr>");
					}
					else
					{
						echo("<tr><td><font style=color:white;font-size:9pt>Character Server<td>: </font></td></td><td><font style=color:red;font-size:9pt>Offline</font></td></tr>");					
					}
					
					if($status3){
						echo("<tr><td><font style=color:white;font-size:9pt>Login Server<td>: </font></td></td><td><font style=color:red;font-size:9pt>Offline</font></td></tr>");
					}
					else
					{
						echo("<tr><td><font style=color:white;font-size:9pt>Login Server<td>: </font></td></td><td><font style=color:red;font-size:9pt>Offline</font></td></tr>");					
					}
				?>

EDIT: Don’t say it’s offline, because it is in fact online.

I used another server status, it says it’s online, but I want to make my own.

Read full topic
